parameters.name: CompressMethod
parameters.description:
The compression algorithm. Valid values:

*   octree
*   kdtree

parameters.name: CredentialConfig
parameters.description:
**If you have no special requirements, leave this parameter empty.**

The configurations of authorization chains. This parameter is optional. For more information, see [Use authorization chains to access resources of other entities](~~465340~~).

parameters.name: Notification
parameters.description:
The notification settings. For information about the asynchronous notification format, see [Asynchronous message examples](~~2743997~~).

>  The IMM operation does not support a callback URL. We recommend that you use Simple Message Queue (SMQ) to receive notifications.

parameters.name: PointCloudFields
parameters.description:
The PCD property fields and the compression order in which the data is decompressed after the compression is complete.

*   If octree of Point Cloud Library (PCL) is used for compression, \["xyz"] is supported.
*   If Draco k-dimensional (k-d) tree is used for compression, \["xyz"] and \["xyz", "intensity"] are supported.

parameters.name: PointCloudFileFormat
parameters.description: The file format. Set the value to the default value: pcd.

parameters.name: ProjectName
parameters.description: The name of the project. For more information, see [CreateProject](~~478153~~).

parameters.name: SourceURI
parameters.description:
The OSS URL of the PCD file.

Specify the value in the oss://${Bucket}/${Object} format. `${Bucket}` specifies the name of the OSS bucket that resides in the same region as the current project. `${Object}` specifies the path of the object with the extension included.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The custom tags, which can be used to search for and filter asynchronous tasks.

parameters.name: TargetURI
parameters.description:
The OSS URL of the output file after compression.

Specify the value in the oss://${Bucket}/${Object} format. `${Bucket}` specifies the name of the OSS bucket that resides in the same region as the current project. `${Object}` specifies the path of the object with the extension included.

parameters.name: UserData
parameters.description: The custom data, which is returned in an asynchronous notification and facilitates notification management. The maximum length is 2,048 bytes.
